BodRawD328.Transcription: Ion Ion pyke a boneto morrow þu schall pyke none
BodRawD328.Note:
Translating ‘Iohannes opica qui cras os non opicabis
                    nullum’, which precedes; English portion all written on one
                    line.
BodRawD328.Editions:
Meech,  Sanford Brown. 
             “A Collection of Proverbs in Rawlinson MS D 328.” 
             Modern Philology
         38 (1940-41): 113-32: 119.
Sisam,  Celia,  and  Kenneth Sisam, eds.  
             The Oxford Book of Medieval English Verse.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1970: 560.
